title: A Better breed
brief_description: An account of the mechanism by which inherited characteristics are handed on from generation to generation, and an introduction to Mendel’s Laws of heredity. Gives examples of the inheritance of one or more characteristics; complete and incomplete dominance; and the recombinations of characteristics resulting in new types; refers to the practical aspects of this in connection with animal husbandry. No other credits available.
